concept.name: Domestic general news
a
concept.definition: Domestic general news items, including local Washington news of national interest.

concept.name: d
Food, diet
concept.definition: Food, diet. For use primarily on standing advance features on food, recipes and the like. Frequently used with stories in the Lifestyles package.

concept.name: Entertainment
e
concept.definition: Entertainment, television and culture news and features.

concept.name: f
News copy
concept.definition: News copy, regardless of dateline, designed primarily for use on financial pages.

concept.name: i
International items
concept.definition: International items, including stories from the United Nations, U.S. possessions, and undated roundups keyed to foreign events.

concept.name: j
News copy
concept.definition: Lottery results only. (Stories about lotteries or lottery winners carry standard news category codes.)

concept.name: Commentary
k
concept.definition: Commentary. Material designed primarily for editorial and op-ed pages. (Not used on national DataStream services.)

concept.name: Stories of state or regional interest under domestic datelines
n
concept.definition: Stories of state or regional interest under domestic datelines, including general news stories with Washington or international datelines. If a regional item is designed primarily for financial pages, the f category is used, and if it is designed primarily for the sports pages, the s category is used.

concept.name: Weather
o
concept.definition: Weather tables and forecast fixtures. Do not use on weather stories.

concept.name: National political
p
concept.definition: National political copy. Generally used in months before an election.

concept.name: period score
q
concept.definition: Use only for result or period score of a single sports event. The code is designed to help newspaper computer systems build a list of scores or ignore individual scores and wait for transmissions that group them.

concept.name: Sports stories.
s
concept.definition: Sports stories, standings and results of more than one event.

concept.name: Advisories
v
concept.definition: Advisories about stories that may carry any of the category letters. This code is also used for news digests and news advisories.

concept.name: w
Washington
concept.definition: Washington-datelined stories handled by the Washington national news desk. The category code is changed to a or i if a subsequent lead shifts to a different city.
